greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by upwards antidiagonals: T(m,n) = number of set partitions of the multiset consisting of one copy each of x_1, x_2, ..., x_m, and two copies each of y_1, y_2, ..., y_n, for m >= 0, n >= 0.
reference: D. E. Knuth, The Art of Computer Programming, Vol. 4A, Table A-1, page 778.
formula: Knuth p. 779 gives a recurrence using the Bell numbers A000110 (see Maple program).
maple: P := proc(m,n) local k; global B; option remember;
(1/2)*( P(m+2,n-1) + P(m+1,n-1) + add( binomial(n-1,k)*P(m,k), k=0..n-1) ); fi; end; # P(m,n) (which is Knuth's notation) is T(m,n)
mathematica: Table[P[m-n, n], {m, 0, 8}, {n, 0, m}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 02 2019, from Maple *)
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = if(k==0, sum(j=0, n, stirling(n, j, 2)), (T(n+2, k-1)+T(n+1, k-1)+sum(j=0, k-1, binomial(k-1, j)*T(n, j)))/2)} \\ _Seiichi Manyama_, Nov 21 2020
xref: See A322770 for partitions into distinct parts.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 30 2018
